column4: i guess not can any one tell me why my usb device will not accept an adress when its plugged in
a wlan stick?
any device but no its a printer im working on atm
its the hardware address ubuntu-server is trying to give the printer when i plug it in
that shouldent matter because NO usb deveice isent accepting the hardware address
..ah ok..so dmesg doesn t give an appropiate message??
just says cant enumerate usb device on port 3
modules areeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee loaded?
what modules do you need for usb / doesent the kernel load them at boot
that brings me back to the first question what modules are needed for usb
first do lsmod |grep usb
you command phails
try sudo modprobe -r usbhid
same error
do u use mouse or usb keyboard??
nope i have an old ps/2 keyboard its a dell poweredge 2650 "rack draw" running ubuntu server i dont need a mouse :D
if the module was missing modprobe would have failed ???
try lsmod and look for usbhid
lsmod | grep usbhid fails just drops me back to terminal with no output
do you use vmware or other sw??
nope its running dedicated
i have tested...if i check the usbhid module isn t loaded at startup because vmware only uses ps2..after a sudo modprobe usbhid the module gets loaded
